title: The Function Factory
story: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform specific tasks. Instead of writing the same code repeatedly, you define a function once and call it whenever needed. They're the building blocks of organized programs!
instructions: Define a function called `greet` that prints "Hello, World!". Then call the function twice so it prints the greeting two times.
solutionHidden:
def greet():
    print("Hello, World!")

greet()
greet()

tests.expectedBehavior: Must define a function called greet
Calling greet() twice should print message twice

hints.text: Function syntax: def function_name(): followed by indented code block
Define the function with print inside, then call it by writing greet() twice
def greet(): print("Hello, World!"), then call greet() on two separate lines
